data.title: Deborah Meaden's net worth now: Is she the richest Dragon?
data.meta_description: How much is Deborah Meaden's net worth now? And is she the richest Dragon in the famous den? Get to know more about this British business woman income here.
data.text:
Many Dragons are successful business owners who turn around millions every year. They have considerable fortunes in the bank thanks to their incredible careers. Deborah Meaden's net worth is a testament to these Dragons' impressive wealth.

Deborah Meaden is a renowned British businesswoman, television personality, radio personality, and author. Deborah is famous for appearing as a Dragon on the Dragon’s Den business program on BBC since 2006. She has invested in more than 60 businesses since she joined the Dragon’s Den.

Deborah Meaden's profile summary

Full nameDeborah Sonia MeadenNicknameDeborah MeadenGenderFemale Date of birth11th February 1959 Age64 years old as of 2023 Zodiac sign AquariusPlace of birth Taunton, Somerset, EnglandCurrent residenceLangport, Somerset, United Kingdom NationalityBritishEthnicityWhite ReligionAtheistSexualityStraight Height in feet5’ 6’’Height in centimetres168Weight in pounds67Weight in kilograms148 Body measurements in inches37-26-38Body measurements in centimetres95-67-97Bra size 42D (US)Hair colourBlonde Eye colourBlue MotherSonia Meaden Step-fatherBrian Meaden SiblingsOne (Gail)Relationship statusMarried PartnerPaul Farmer SchoolGodolphin School and Trowbridge High School for Girls CollegeBrighton Technical College Profession British businessperson and TV personalityNet worth$60 million

Deborah Meaden's net worth

Is Deborah Meaden a billionaire? She is not yet a billionaire. Deborah has an estimated net worth of $60 million as of 2023. She has made a considerable sum of money from her investments.

How did Deborah Meaden make her money? She made money through business ventures, appearing on television shows, and writing books. Here are the highlights of these ventures:

Deborah Meaden's businesses

Deborah began her first business at 19, establishing a glass and ceramics export agency. She sold her products to retailers but failed after one and a half years. Later, together with her partner, she bought the Stefanel textile franchise, but after two years, she sold it out to her partner for £10,000.

In 1988, she started running a family amusement arcade operations business. Meaden then led a management buyout and acquired the major shareholding. Ultimately, she bagged £19 million after her stake was liquidated. She has also invested in:

Fox Brothers a textile mill in Wellington, Somerset

The Merchant Fox an online store selling British-made luxury goods

Whisky Me & The Drinks and Snacks, a liquor brand and supplier

Hope & Ivy fashion label

Apart from that, she has invested in several firms and local brands, including:

Shakesphere

Yee Kwan Ice Cream

Spoon Cereals

FitMix

Itae Group

RemPods

Dock & Bay

Clean Heels

Swing Patrol

Boot Buddy

Television career

Deborah has established herself as a British television personality. Her most notable TV role is as one of the dragons on the British TV program Dragon’s Den. She took over from Rachel Elnaugh in season three in August 2006.

As of 2023, she has invested approximately £3.3 million in over 60 businesses. Some of her most notable investments in Dragon’s Den include:

Reggae Reggae Sauce - £50,000 for 40% stake

Craft Gin Club and Bubble Club - £75,000 for a 12.5% share

Magic Whiteboard - £100,000 investment

Wonderbly - a £100,000 investment at a 4% stake

Skinny Tan - £600,000 for a 10% stake

ChocBox - £150,000 investment

Deborah Meaden's deodorant (Toddle and Fussy) - £50,000 for a 5% stake

Her other television appearances include:

Strictly Come Dancing,

Friday Night with Jonathan Ross

The Great British Bake Off: An Extra Slice

The Great Stand Up to Cancer Bake Off

Let's Do Lunch with Gino & Mel

Alan Carr: Chatty Man

Don't Ask Me Ask Britain

The Chase: Celebrity Special

The Alan Titchmarsh Show

The Guess List

Murder in Successville

8 Out of 10 Cats

Author and co-presenter

She has participated in several other money-making ventures besides business and television. For instance, she has appeared in two director's magazines, 15 Ways to Boost Up Your Business and 15 Growth Tips in 5 Minutes.

She is an avid reader and writer. She published her first solo book, Common Sense Rules, on 1st July 2010. She has also co-authored:

Dragons’ Den: Success

From Pitch to Profit

Dragons’ Den: Your Road to Success

Since March 2020, she has been a co-presenter on BBC Radio 5 live, The Big Green Money Show, along with Felicity Hannah.

Endorsement deals

The British businesswoman has a few lucrative endorsement deals. For instance, she signed a deal with the Japanese automotive manufacturer Toyota. She bags large sums of money and cars from the company yearly from the deal.

House and cars

Where does Deborah Meaden live? The TV personality lives in Langport, Somerset, United Kingdom. Deborah and her husband purchased the luxurious house for $25 million in 2016. Even though it is one of the oldest houses in Somerset, the couple refurbished it for around $2 million.

The house sits on a 16-acre piece of land, and as a pet lover, she has several animals living in the neighbourhood. Also, she conducts some plantation, agricultural, and domestic farming on the land. Some of the key features of her stunning mansion and its surroundings include:

Ten bedrooms

Eight bathrooms

Three powder rooms

Lush landscaping

The British business lady also owns several high-end cars in her garage. She loves electric cars believing they will reduce fuel consumption one day. Her car collection includes:

BMWi worth $84,000 (electric)

Toyota worth between $20,000 and $50,000 (electric)

Rolls Royce Cullinan worth $330,000

2021 Toyota Corolla worth $25,400

Deborah Meaden's fast facts

Who is Deborah Meaden? Deborah Meaden is a British businessperson, TV personality, radio personality, and author.

Why did Deborah leave Dragons Den? Deborah has not left the Dragon’s Den and has no intentions of leaving anytime soon.

How old is Deborah Meaden? Deborah Meaden is 64 years old as of 2023. She was born on 11th February 1959 in Taunton, Somerset, England.

How much is Deborah Meaden’s net worth? Deborah Meaden has an estimated net worth of $60 million as of 2023.

How did Deborah Meaden make her money? Deborah Meaden made money through several successful business ventures, appearing on television and radio and writing books.

When did Deborah Meaden join Dragon's Den? Deborah Meaden joined Dragon's Den in season three in 2006. She took over from Rachel Elnaugh.

Where does Deborah Meaden live? Deborah Meaden lives in Langport, Somerset, United Kingdom.

Deborah Meaden's net worth - Wrapping up

How much is Deborah Meaden's net worth? The renowned Dragon has an estimated net worth of $60 million as of 2023. Apart from the wealth, she is arguably the fieriest Dragon in the famous den and the fourth richest of the current Dragons.

Tuko.co.ke published an article about Shane Gillis. He is an American stand-up comedian, sketch comedy writer, radio personality, YouTuber, and podcast host. He is well known for his brief stint on Saturday Night Live.

Shane was announced as the new addition to Saturday Night Live as a featured guest. Unfortunately, his position was short-lived, as he was sacked four days later due to public outrage over some controversial statements he made in the past.

Source: TUKO.co.ke
